Sentencas: Gadolinium-doped ceria/yttria-stabilized zirconia bilayer electrolytes have received significant attention for use in solid oxide fuel cells since this electrolyte enables the use of a cobalt-containing cathode, which show a high performance at low temperature.
Titulo: Facile fabrication strategy of highly dense gadolinium-doped ceria/yttria-stabilized zirconia bilayer electrolyte via cold isostatic pressing for low temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: However, the low sintering temperature of the bilayer electrolyte, which is required to avoid side reactions, results in low density, limiting its practical applications.
Titulo: Facile fabrication strategy of highly dense gadolinium-doped ceria/yttria-stabilized zirconia bilayer electrolyte via cold isostatic pressing for low temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: In this study, we report a facile and cost-effective method for the fabrication of dense gadolinium-doped ceria/yttria-stabilized zirconia bilayer electrolytes at low temperatures.
Titulo: Facile fabrication strategy of highly dense gadolinium-doped ceria/yttria-stabilized zirconia bilayer electrolyte via cold isostatic pressing for low temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Even at a low sintering temperature of 1250 degrees C, a thin and dense bilayer electrolyte structure was achieved using an isostatic pressure process on the dip-coated electrolyte layers and anode support substrate.
Titulo: Facile fabrication strategy of highly dense gadolinium-doped ceria/yttria-stabilized zirconia bilayer electrolyte via cold isostatic pressing for low temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Solid oxide fuel cells adopting this dense gadolinium-doped ceria/yttria-stabilized zirconia bilayer electrolyte exhibited high power density of 1.251 W cm(-2) at 650 degrees C and high stability for 100 h. These significant improvements in performances is attributed to the greatly reduced porosity (< 2.5%) of the bilayer electrolyte when there are no side reactions between the gadolinium-doped ceria and yttria-stabilized zirconia layers.
Titulo: Facile fabrication strategy of highly dense gadolinium-doped ceria/yttria-stabilized zirconia bilayer electrolyte via cold isostatic pressing for low temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The strategies presented here provide general guidelines on electrolyte design and processing for the fabrication of high-performance solid oxide fuel cells with low operation temperature, low cost and mass-producibility.
Titulo: Facile fabrication strategy of highly dense gadolinium-doped ceria/yttria-stabilized zirconia bilayer electrolyte via cold isostatic pressing for low temperature solid oxide fuel cells
